reviews.review_msg: Jonny is awesome. This course is packed with information, but if you're willing to put in the work you'll do well. Jonny is a tough grader, but I think he's just trying to set you up for success in the future, making sure that you know your stuff.

Jonny's class made me almost switch my major. He is an amazing teacher and knows so much about the topic. That being said the exams were hard. But if you study the exam guide you will be okay. The field trip was so much fun and being able to practically apply our skills was great.

this is for geog213. Jonny is a great professor, it is clear to see that he understands the material at a deep level and that inspires you to do well in his course. Jonny is by far the best professor I had at SFU so far, if you have the option of taking one of his classes, do it.

I think the grading criteria could be clearer because I didnt understand a lot of the times why I lost marks on things (went to office hours too) but overall pretty standard for a 100 level course. Ive had worse and better before.

This was a simple class that Jonathan over complicated for no reason. I'm not sure if it was a lack of preparation or just not understanding how to teach. If I didn't have a geography background I would have done bad but luckily I learned a lot of this before

Seems passionate about Geography, but not a good professor at all. Extremely disorganized both on Canvas and lecturing, as well as pretty disrespectful to students, which made it difficult to want to answer questions in class or approach him to get help. I wish I took this with a different professor. Though, the lab portion with my TA was great! :)

Fantastic professor. Open book tests meant they were straightforward and low stress. Labs were easy as the TA gave the answer to each question after the whole class did it. Lab test based off the labs 1:1. Tests were made up of labelling diagrams (where diagrams were from the slides) and short written questions, which were easy as it was open book.
